did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science legal papers concerning Wagner Free Institute of Science vs. City of Philadelphia

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence (1885-1889) regarding the Wagner Free Institute of Science vs. the City of Philadelphia regarding the Wagner's tax liabilities for rental properties owned by the Institute. It includes correspondence from S.J. Skidmore, Geo. W. Morris, Geo. M. Biddle, Charles B. McMichael, R.B. Westbrook, Henry B. Foulke, Boyd Crumrine, Chas. S. Greene, W.W. Montgomery, James H. McKenney, and Samuel Wagner.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
